# UnitConcentrationMass

**Class**

A unit of measure for concentration of mass.

## Declaration

```swift
class UnitConcentrationMass
```

## Overview

You typically use instances of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConcentrationMass] to represent specific quantities of concentration using the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMeasurement] class.

### Concentration of Mass

Concentration is the abundance of a constituent within a volume. Concentration can be expressed by SI derived units in terms of kilograms per cubic meter (kg/m3).

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConcentrationMass] class defines its [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Dimension/baseUnit()] as [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConcentrationMass/gramsPerLiter], and provides the following units, which are initialized using [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConverterLinear] converters with the specified coefficients:



## Accessing the Base Unit

- **baseUnit()**: Returns the base unit.

## Accessing Predefined Units

- **gramsPerLiter**: The grams per liter unit of concentration.
- **milligramsPerDeciliter**: The milligrams per deciliter unit of concentration.
- **millimolesPerLiter(withGramsPerMole:)**: Returns the millimoles per liter unit with the specified number of grams per mole.

## Concentration and Dispersion

- **UnitDispersion**: A unit of measure for specific quantities of dispersion.

## Inherits From

- Dimension

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
